author: Telegraph Staff
title: Inside England's £500-a-night Euro 2016 hotel
text:
MORE... 
The England Football Assocation has confirmed where the England football team will hang up their boots each night during the European Championships 2016 in France — the ultra-ostentatious, Michelin-starred, £500-a-night Auberge du Jeu de Paume château, in Chantilly, 25 miles from Paris. 
The hotel is located on a sprawling 20,000-acre estate that could fit 10,000 football pitches. Although there isn't a space formally dedicated to kicking about a ball as such, there is a French garden designed by Le Nôtre, a romantically-themed jardin anglais — complete with fountain, an "island of love", and temple dedicated to Venus — as well as a maze, a small forest, and the Condé museum, which has the second-largest collection of classical art in France, after the Louvre.
